intro: Drypetes arcuatinervia var. elongata, commonly known as the long-veined drypetes, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves with prominent venation. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers followed by orange or red fruits that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
